author: Chris Wright
title: Liverpool star Adam Lallana gorges on eight meals in a day to boost energy
text:
Liverpool star Adam Lallana gorges on eight meals in a day to boost energy Adam Lallana has detailed his extensive eating plan. 
Not very long ago, Adam Lallana achieved the impressive feat of topping the Premier League's distance covered chart twice in the space of 44 hours when Liverpool played Manchester City and Sunderland in quick succession over the New Year period. 
It turns out this wasn't a fluke, as Lallana had actually taken on enough fuel in those two days to feed an entire zoo for a week! 
Talking to Liverpool's official website, the England midfielder detailed his diet and nutritional regime, revealing that he ate no less than eight meals in the 24 hours after the City game. 
First came a plate of pasta in the dressing room straight after the final whistle, swiftly followed by another, bigger plate of pasta and meat when he got home at 10:30pm. 
The following day was another veritable all-you-can-eat buffet of snacks and carbo-loading. 
"I think I woke up about 7.45am and had toast in bed. Then I went downstairs and about 10 o'clock, I had some Weetabix with banana," Lallana said. 
"At midday, my old man was up at my house so he made bacon and egg sandwiches in a bap, so I had two of them. 
"I got into training at 3pm for recovery and had a yoghurt and a Ryvita-type bread with chicken on and another shake. 
"We did recovery and then after that, I had pasta, chicken and veg. We travelled to Sunderland, got there about 8.30pm at night and there was a big sandwich station set up for us -- so I had two big sandwiches, packed with meat, and a yoghurt. 
"Then the next day, on the morning of the game, you eat as much as you can." 
By our reckoning, that's an overall count of roughly 2,680 calories in less than a day -- 680 more than the recommended intake for the average man. 
No wonder Lallana is all energy. 
Chris covers the funny side of the game for ESPN FC in the Toe Poke blog.
